main: ^a basilica in Cebu City in the Philippines that was founded in 1565.

c-0: ^It is the oldest Roman Catholic church in the country, allegedly built on the spot where the image of the Santo Niño de Cebú was found during the expedition of Miguel López de Legazpi. Known as the "Mother and Head of all Churches in the Philippines".
^The church has always been the Sanctuary of the Sto. Niño, under the custody of the Augustinians.
